Kamala Harris: s support for the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) program, which demonstrates her prioritization of protecting undocumented youth.
The 2008 San Francisco policy: supported by Harris, that reported undocumented youth to federal immigration officials upon their arrest, regardless of whether they were found guilty of a crime.
The change in San Francisco: s policy in 2008, initiated by then Mayor Gavin Newsom, to report arrested undocumented youth to ICE after a 21-year-old undocumented man was arrested for killing three members of a family.
The Board of Supervisors: decision to overturn Newsom's policy in 2009, indicating a shift in the city's approach to reporting arrested undocumented youth to federal immigration authorities.
